channel.title: Deltascape Character Manager!
channel.description:
I have a question, do you ever find yourself struggling to find a character file in your hundreds or thousands of character files? Now those frustrating times will soon come to an end! Good news for people who aren't using 'Godscape!', the Delta Scape character manager is in production
Posted on Mopar Scape, google and google
Hey guys today I am starting to show the Visual Basic .NET program I have been coding for the past two days. So far I have only made the GUI*, and my Visual Basic teacher at school is helping me write code for tokenizing each line of code so it will appear in the GUI. I am making my program read each of the following components.
[IMG]http://kylecodes.com/screenie.png[/img]
Main Page
[ul] [*] username - ummm... the username? :P [*] password - un-hashed password (Delta is famous for saving in hashed passwords) [*] posX - x position [*] posY - y position [*] donator - a choice box to choose if the player is a donator, or if they are not. [*] playerRights - drop down menu to choose (player, mod, admin, owner, hidden) [*] on the left side will be a list box to choose a character's file to open (a simple double click) [*] open button - if you highlight a specific player, just press the open button to view their file [*] save button - if you highlight a specific player, just press the save button to save the file [*] Stats button - press this to go to the stats page. scroll down.. [*] Bank button - scroll down for more information..[/ul]
Stats Page
[ul] [*] view all the normal stats (no construction or summoning or gay skills not 317 related) [*] ability to change the level with a drop down menu so then you don't have to enter 83 for level 2! [*] open button - if you highlight a specific player, just press the open button to view their file [*] save button - if you highlight a specific player, just press the save button to save the file [*] Bank button - scroll down for more information..[/ul]
Bank Page
[ul] [*] view all items in a players bank (it imports the item.cfg file and tokenizes the file to find the item names for EACH item in a players bank)** [*] Remove button - allows items to be removed from the bank [*] Add button - opens a message box with an input so you can enter the item ID and item amount to add to a player file[/ul]
This is all I have thought out as of today. Thanks for reading this. I will hope to add pictures by 9/23/09 I have my program files at school or I would screenie them now
If you have any ideas on how I could improve this project to benefit the Deltascape users, please post.
Credits: Coding - 80% Nortonkid . - 20% Nortonkid's Visual Basic teacher :D Images - 100% Nortonkid Ideas - 90% Jeremy Yak . - 10% Nortonkid
* - Graphical User Interface ** - I have not yet figured out how to make the item amounts and the item names sync up :/

item.title: Deltascape Character Manager!
item.dc:creator: @nortonkid123 nortonkid123
item.description:
@nortonkid123 wrote:

I will be doing that in the next week. I only spend about 30-60 minutes on it per day since it hogs a lot of resources to use Microsoft Visual Studios 2008… I only got 1gb of RAM on my Mac and running parallels in my mac cuts my ram in half. I need 1.5gigs to run visual studios at the right speed so I think I need 2-3 gigs of ram :[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 27, 2009, 08:41:30 pm[/size][hr]bump
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 02, 2009, 07:41:30 pm[/size][hr]reply pl0x

Read full topic

Release a “Beta” version of it. I want to play around with it.
Looks really helpful.

item.title: Deltascape Character Manager!
item.dc:creator: @nortonkid123 nortonkid123
item.description:
@nortonkid123 wrote:

Well for now it will only work for Delta. There are two other char managers that I know of. Not many were made for one base. They were made for very specific server requirements. So I hope this can make people’s server management a lot easier.

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascape Character Manager!
item.dc:creator: @nortonkid123 nortonkid123
item.description:
@nortonkid123 wrote:

zyle1992:

Why not in Java?

While I am well versed in Java, I want to try something new. If I really wanted to I code integrate it with Rog3r’s iPanel, but Java is a little slow if you know what I am saying.

Maybe some day I will put my work from VB .NET into Java. Who knows? If this project is successful I most certainly might :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 25, 2009, 05:47:39 pm[/size][hr]Just added a search field. My goal for the weekend is to get the main screen 100% up and running. Then work on the Stats and Items screen during the week.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 25, 2009, 06:16:03 pm[/size][hr]NEWS: Just added a search field. My goal for the weekend is to get the main screen 100% up and running. Then work on the Stats and Items screen during the week.

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascape Character Manager!
item.dc:creator: @nortonkid123 nortonkid123
item.description:
@nortonkid123 wrote:

I Can Tell You Copyed , & Pasted Someone Elses Work Onto Here.

Wow. Next time back up your story before you post. It hurts to see that people believe legitimate work is copied.

vamp256:

Pass word “un-hashing” is easy.

Its not a matter of having it be easy. It is just included so that way people can actually see the passwords. for lost accounts or things of that nature.

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascape Character Manager!
item.dc:creator: @nortonkid123 nortonkid123
item.description:
@nortonkid123 wrote:

I have a question, do you ever find yourself struggling to find a character file in your hundreds or thousands of character files? Now those frustrating times will soon come to an end! Good news for people who aren’t using ‘Godscape!’, the Delta Scape character manager is in production

Posted on Mopar Scape, google and google

Hey guys today I am starting to show the Visual Basic .NET program I have been coding for the past two days. So far I have only made the GUI*, and my Visual Basic teacher at school is helping me write code for tokenizing each line of code so it will appear in the GUI. I am making my program read each of the following components.

Main Page

[ul] [] username - ummm… the username?
[] password - un-hashed password (Delta is famous for saving in hashed passwords)
[] posX - x position
[] posY - y position
[] donator - a choice box to choose if the player is a donator, or if they are not.
[] playerRights - drop down menu to choose (player, mod, admin, owner, hidden)
[] on the left side will be a list box to choose a character’s file to open (a simple double click)
[] open button - if you highlight a specific player, just press the open button to view their file
[] save button - if you highlight a specific player, just press the save button to save the file
[] Stats button - press this to go to the stats page. scroll down…
[*] Bank button - scroll down for more information…[/ul]

Stats Page

[ul] [] view all the normal stats (no construction or summoning or gay skills not 317 related)
[] ability to change the level with a drop down menu so then you don’t have to enter 83 for level 2!
[] open button - if you highlight a specific player, just press the open button to view their file
[] save button - if you highlight a specific player, just press the save button to save the file
[*] Bank button - scroll down for more information…[/ul]

Bank Page

[ul] [] view all items in a players bank (it imports the item.cfg file and tokenizes the file to find the item names for EACH item in a players bank)**
[] Remove button - allows items to be removed from the bank
[*] Add button - opens a message box with an input so you can enter the item ID and item amount to add to a player file[/ul]

This is all I have thought out as of today. Thanks for reading this. I will hope to add pictures by 9/23/09 I have my program files at school or I would screenie them now

If you have any ideas on how I could improve this project to benefit the Deltascape users, please post.
